intro: Hieronymiella tarijensis, commonly known as the Tarijensis Hieronymiella, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
